text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with ham and shrimp gravy you can
call this shrimp and grits if you want
but I'm not going to and I'll explain
why later but it is inspired by that
recipe and here's how you do it alright
so before we start cooking we got to
prep our vegetables which we call the
Holy Trinity celery onions and peppers
I'm using red bell peppers jalapeno for
onion I'm using scallions also known as
green onions and of course celery celery
you can also sneak some garlic in here
no problem
so that's a pretty small dice once
that's done set it aside and we're gonna
head over to the stove in a deep frying
pan you can also use a saucepan or a
Dutch oven something like that we're
gonna melt some butter over medium heat
and yes that is a lot of butter but
that's ok because we're gonna add diced
ham to it so I diced up some smoked ham
nice and small I'm gonna cook that in
the butter five or six minutes and then
I'm gonna add the vegetables how do I
know when to add the vegetables I want
you to cook it until the ham is too
delicious smelling to stand you're also
gonna look for just a little bit of
browning on the ham not too much at that
point we're gonna add our vegetables and
we're gonna soften those vegetables in
that hammy butter for about five or six
minutes we just want to soften slightly
I'm just gonna stay on medium heat the
whole way through basically so that
looks pretty good at that point I'm
going to dump in my Cajun seasoning now
I'd love to tell you this is some exotic
blend I brought back from my last trip
to New Orleans but it's not it's right
off the supermarket shelf basic
name-brand Cajun seasoning all right
dump it in there cook it for one minute
at that point I'm gonna add some flour
to make pop quiz what's it called a roux
that's right very good I'm gonna stir my
flour in and I'm gonna cook that for
about three minutes now the only way you
can screw this up and it's not easy by
the way is to burn the roux which you're
not going to coz you're only on medium
heat and you're going to keep stirring
it and you're not gonna let it you know
get all black on the bottom so about
three minutes later it looked like that
and I'm on to the next step which is
adding some ice-cold chicken broth
remember cold liquid into hot Roux no
lumps so stir in your chicken broth
we're gonna raise our heat to
medium-high and we're gonna simmer this
for about ten to fifteen minutes okay by
the way don't skim off the butter from
the top it's not grease it's butter and
that's gonna actually emulsify back into
the sauce as it cooks down and that'll
be kind of an important flavor component
so don't skim that off okay so like I
said we're gonna cook this about 10 to
15 minutes until two things happen one
the vegetables are gonna soften and
sweeten all right you don't want crunchy
vegetables in this and two that liquids
going to reduce and thicken into a
beautiful luxurious amazing amazing
gravy which is what we have right there
okay so when it gets to that perfect
texture look at that so perfect turn
your heat down to medium-low had your
shrimp raw peeled and deveined shrimp
never cook with cooked shrimp do not buy
cooked shrimp you want it raw we're
gonna add that in that only takes a
couple minutes to cook so give it a stir
and when that shrimp cooks through I'm
gonna adjust the seasoning with some
cayenne and salt if it needs it you
taste it and then to finish a few more
green onions and we're done okay so how
simple was that other than a little
dicing nothing to it and if you don't
think that looks great I don't know
what's wrong with you
something's wrong with you then it's
time to serve you're gonna ladle this
over in my case grits now personally and
the reason I'm not calling this shrimp
and grits I think this is best over rice
or mashed potatoes that would be my
choice why did I serve it over grits
because my wife Michelle likes grits so
a little unsolicited advice for you
newly married men there's two ways to do
things the way your wife likes them and
the wrong way so I serve this over grits
and it was fantastic so there you go
ham and shrimp gravy could not be
simpler start to finish about a
half-hour maybe 40 minutes at the most
and you have a delicious spicy
comforting stick-to-your-ribs type meal
so I hope you give this a try all the
ingredients are
food whooshes calm as usual and as
always enjoy
you
